data: For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Administration of Nitrous Oxide in Oxygen
Use a standardized pain scale, such as verbal rating scale (0 to 10). Refer to Clinical Practice Document: Discomfort and Pain in Labour
Increase frequency of fetal health monitoring

Indications: 
- Discomfort and pain in labour

Contraindications:
- Compromised respiratory status
- Excessive maternal sedation
- Unable to do self-administration

PRN, self administer for pain and discompfort in labour.  Breathe in and out deeply and fairly rapidly at onset of contraction. Contine to breathe deeply but less freauenly throughout the remainder of contraction . Stop inhalation at end of contraction
